item.title: The Origin of the Project
item.description:
This project was born in mid-2025 after working extensively with AI assistants and having to provide context over and over again. The idea was to create a tool that would make information management and retrieval efficient and effective. There were different solutions at that time, but most were based on traditional text-only approaches:

  • Solutions based on markdown files or similar.
  • Solutions based on relational databases like SQLite.

However, after working with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) in some projects for semantic information search, I believed something better could be done. Around that time, the paper and open-source project Mem0 appeared, proposing an MCP server approach that stored information in structured knowledge graphs and other elements.

item.title: Why is it called Remembrances?
item.description:
The name Remembrances carries a deep and special meaning that reflects the essence and purpose of the project. The word “remembrances” in English refers to “memories” or “recollections,” which perfectly encapsulates the platform’s mission: to help preserve, organize, and access valuable information and knowledge.

The name was chosen to highlight the importance of remembering and safeguarding important data in a world where information can easily be lost. Remembrances acts as a guardian of these digital memories, ensuring that users can retrieve and use their information whenever they need it.
